verses.kjv: Hear this word that the LORD hath spoken against you, O children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up from the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.ct: Listen to this message that the LORD has spoken about you, people of Israel — about the entire nation that I brought out of the land of Egypt:

verses.kjv: You only have I known of all the families of the earth: therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities.
verses.ct: "Out of all the nations on earth, you are the only ones I chose. That is why I will hold you accountable for all your sins."

verses.kjv: Can two walk together, except they be agreed?
verses.ct: Do 2 people walk together unless they have arranged to meet?

verses.kjv: Will a lion roar in the forest, when he hath no prey? will a young lion cry out of his den, if he have taken nothing?
verses.ct: Does a lion roar in the forest when it has no prey? Does a young lion growl from its den unless it has caught something?

verses.kjv: Can a bird fall in a snare upon the earth, where no gin is for him? shall one take up a snare from the earth, and have taken nothing at all?
verses.ct: Does a bird get caught in a trap on the ground when no trap has been set? Does a snare spring up from the ground without catching anything?

verses.kjv: Shall a trumpet be blown in the city, and the people not be afraid? shall there be evil in a city, and the LORD hath not done it?
verses.ct: When a trumpet sounds an alarm in a city, don't the people tremble? When disaster strikes a city, hasn't the LORD brought it about?

verses.kjv: Surely the Lord GOD will do nothing, but he revealeth his secret unto his servants the prophets.
verses.ct: The truth is, the Lord GOD does nothing without first revealing his plan to his servants the prophets.

verses.kjv: The lion hath roared, who will not fear? the Lord GOD hath spoken, who can but prophesy?
verses.ct: A lion has roared — who wouldn't be terrified? The Lord GOD has spoken — who can keep from prophesying?

verses.kjv: Publish in the palaces at Ashdod, and in the palaces in the land of Egypt, and say, Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of Samaria, and behold the great tumults in the midst thereof, and the oppressed in the midst thereof.
verses.ct: Make this announcement in the fortresses of Ashdod and in the fortresses of Egypt: "Gather on the mountains around Samaria and see the widespread chaos inside it, and the oppression taking place there."

verses.kjv: For they know not to do right, saith the LORD, who store up violence and robbery in their palaces.
verses.ct: "They don't even know how to do what is right," says the LORD. "They pile up violence and stolen goods in their fortresses."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; An adversary there shall be even round about the land; and he shall bring down thy strength from thee, and thy palaces shall be spoiled.
verses.ct: So this is what the Lord GOD says: "An enemy will surround the land. He will tear down your defenses, and your fortresses will be looted."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; As the shepherd taketh out of the mouth of the lion two legs, or a piece of an ear; so shall the children of Israel be taken out that dwell in Samaria in the corner of a bed, and in Damascus in a couch.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Just as a shepherd rescues only 2 legs or a scrap of an ear from a lion's mouth, so the Israelites living in Samaria will be rescued — with nothing left but a corner of a bed or a piece of a couch."

verses.kjv: Hear ye, and testify in the house of Jacob, saith the Lord GOD, the God of hosts,
verses.ct: "Listen and give this warning to the descendants of Jacob," says the Lord GOD, the God of Armies.

verses.kjv: That in the day that I shall visit the transgressions of Israel upon him I will also visit the altars of Bethel: and the horns of the altar shall be cut off, and fall to the ground.
verses.ct: "On the day I punish Israel for their sins, I will also destroy the altars at Bethel. The horns of the altar will be cut off and fall to the ground.

verses.kjv: And I will smite the winter house with the summer house; and the houses of ivory shall perish, and the great houses shall have an end, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: I will demolish the winter house along with the summer house. The houses decorated with ivory will be destroyed, and the grand mansions will come to an end," says the LORD.
